the volume at which the playback associated with this route is performed

the category this route belongs to.

The user-visible name of a media route. This is the string presented to users who may select this as the active route.
getName().Description: Gets the user-visible name of the route. The route name identifies the destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied name, an alias, or device serial number.

True if this route is enabled.
isEnabled().Description: Returns true if this route is enabled and may be selected.

Returns: @B_java#lang#String_E@
a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: @B_java#lang#CharSequence_E@
The description of the route, or null if none.
getDescription().Description: Gets the user-visible description of the route. The route description describes the kind of destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied string, a model number or brand of device.

Returns: @B_java#lang#CharSequence_E@
The user-visible name of a media route. This is the string presented to users who may select this as the active route.
Parameters: Context: Context used to resolve the correct configuration to load
getName(android.content.Context).Description: Return the properly localized/resource user-visible name of this route. The route name identifies the destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied name, an alias, or device serial number.

The tag object previously set by the application

@B_android#graphics#drawable#Drawable_E@
the icon representing this route or null if no icon is available
getIconDrawable().Description: Get the icon representing this route. This icon will be used in picker UIs if available.

Parameters: Object: Arbitrary, app-specific data for this route to hold for later use
setTag(java.lang.Object).Description: Set an application-specific tag object for this route. The application may use this to store arbitrary data associated with the route for internal tracking. Note that the lifespan of a route may be well past the lifespan of an Activity or other Context; take care that objects you store here will not keep more data in memory alive than you intend.

Returns: @B_android#view#Display_E@
The preferred presentation display to use when this route is selected or null if none.
getPresentationDisplay().Description: Gets the @B_android#view#Display_E@ that should be used by the application to show a @B_android#app#Presentation_E@ on an external display when this route is selected. Depending on the route, this may only be valid if the route is currently selected. The preferred presentation display may change independently of the route being selected or unselected. For example, the presentation display of the default system route may change when an external HDMI display is connected or disconnected even though the route itself has not changed. This method may return null if there is no external display associated with the route or if the display is not ready to show UI yet. The application should listen for changes to the presentation display using the @B_android#media#MediaRouter#Callback#onRoutePresentationDisplayChanged_E@ callback and show or dismiss its @B_android#app#Presentation_E@ accordingly when the display becomes available or is removed. This method only makes sense for @B_android#media#MediaRouter#ROUTE_TYPE_LIVE_VIDEO_E@ routes.

Returns: int
A media type flag set describing which types this route supports.
